concerts.title: 2nd Formative Assessment
concerts.description: Second formative assessment for startup for Ticketwave to show the prototype
concerts.additionalInfo: Please buy tickets and scan on entry. Entry is free.

concerts.title: The Infinite Dream
concerts.location: Madison Square Garden, New York City, USA
concerts.description: Join Bazzi on a musical journey through 'The Infinite Dream'. This concert promises an intimate yet energetic experience, showcasing Bazzi's soulful vocals and heartfelt lyrics.
concerts.additionalInfo: Doors open at 18:30. Meet & Greet packages available for VIP ticket holders.

concerts.title: MUSIC of the SPHERES
concerts.description: Coldplay's 'Music of the Spheres' world tour lands in London. Expect a cosmic experience with the band's signature anthems, stunning visuals, and eco-friendly concert innovations.
concerts.additionalInfo: This is a sustainable concert. Please bring your own reusable water bottle. Special LED wristbands will be provided.

concerts.title: The +–=÷× Dream
concerts.description: Ed Sheeran brings his mathematical tour to Melbourne. This solo performance showcases Ed's legendary loop pedal skills and heartwarming songs from across his career.
concerts.additionalInfo: No backpacks allowed. Small bags under 30x30cm permitted. Show includes special effects and strobe lighting.

concerts.title: I Met You When I Was 18
concerts.description: Lauv takes fans on a nostalgic journey with 'I Met You When I Was 18'. This concert features his chart-topping hits and new material, promising an emotionally charged night.

venue.name: The O2 Arena
venue.address: Peninsula Square, London SE10 0DX, United Kingdom

concerts.additionalInfo: Special acoustic session included. Early entry for VIP ticket holders at 18:30.

concerts.title: Twice Ready To Be Special
concerts.description: TWICE presents a special two-day concert extravaganza at Nissan Stadium. This unique event showcases new performances and fan-favorite hits in TWICE's biggest show yet.
concerts.additionalInfo: Two-day event. Tickets valid for both days. Special merchandise available exclusively for ticket holders.

concerts.title: Blockchain 101
concerts.description: This two-day workshop offers participants an engaging introduction to Blockchain technology. On Day 1, participants will learn blockchain concepts by playing a widely known boardgame, followed by an Ideation session where they will brainstorm and explore innovative ways to use blockchain technology. Day 2 focuses on pitching these ideas during the Ideathon Pitching session, followed by a Panel Discussion. The event concludes with the announcement of results and prize distribution with a prizepool of 700 USD. This workshop provides hands-on learning and problem-solving experience in the blockchain space, offering participants the chance to showcase their creativity and win exciting prizes. Day 1 runs from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM, and Day 2 runs from 10:00 AM to 2:30 PM.

venue.name: Taylor's University Lakeside Campus
venue.parking: Free open-air parking available behind the university
venue.howToGetThere: LT27 is located at Level 1 of Block C. From the parking area, walk to LT1, continue to LT2 and walk straight, and at the first junction turn right to reach LT27.

concerts.additionalInfo:
Enhance your blockchain knowledge through interactive games and workshops, then participate in an Ideathon to develop innovative solutions and pitch your ideas for a brighter digital future! 

**Judging Criteria**

1. Problem Statement (15 points)

• Is the problem well-defined?

• Is the problem significant and impactful enough to create a solution?

2. Solution & Innovation (40 points)

• What is the proposed solution?

• Is the solution innovative, creative, and unique?

• Does it stand out from generic or already existing ideas?

3. Business Case (10 points)

• Is there a clear path to monetization or sustainability?

• How viable is the business model in the long term?

4. Technical Feasibility (5 points)

• Does the idea demonstrate technical feasibility?

• Optional: Is there a prototype, such as code or a Figma design?

5. Pitching & Demo (15 points)

• How compelling and clear are the slides and the pitch?

• Does the presentation effectively convey the value of the idea?

6. Why Blockchain? (15 points)

• Does the idea justify using blockchain technology?

• Is blockchain essential to the solution, or is it just an optional add-on?

**Judging Decisions**
- The judges' decisions are final and binding.

**Prize Distribution per Team**
- First Place: 140 USD
- Second Place: 90 USD
- Third Place: 60 USD
- 4th to 10th Place: 30 USD each
- 11th to 20th Place: 20 USD each

**Submission Requirements**
- Video presentation (3-5 minutes) explaining your solution
- Pitch deck/slides
- Optional coding or Figma 
- Dealine to submission for Google Form is 22/12/2024 10:00 a.m.
- Team Registration Link: [Click here to register your team](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeiZqX1Q0q5gp1ivYbksA5pYJVYLeI5UdeeKsAotzRIL7HwPA/viewform)
- Feedback on using the ticketing platform and the best feedback will win a RM 30 Starbucks gift card: [Submit your feedback](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdo9kao2_Ue2WXSH25dXCfMjpcTC2IM7QxwaW1NZwViy90bXg/viewform?usp=dialog)
- Ideathon Project Submission Link: [Submit your project](https://forms.gle/dPvRV8PTJq3oHxjy8)

**Summary for Participants:**
- Hands-on Blockchain Workshop with a widely known boardgame
- Access to expert panel discussion
- Refreshment provided
- Ideathon participation with the opportunity to win prizes
- Certificates for participation

**Expected Outcomes:**
- Participants will gain a deeper understanding of blockchain technology and its potential applications.
- Participants will learn to collaborate effectively in teams to create conceptual solutions.
- Winners will receive prizes based on the creativity and feasibility of their ideas.
